abstract: District of Columbia bar committee agrees to deal allowing former Justice Dept lawyer Thomas M Tamm to keep his law license even though he admitted to revealing confidential information to New York Times for 2005 article about National Security Agency's domestic wiretapping program; deal will end decade of investigation into Tamm if it is approved by court of appeals.
lead_paragraph: Thomas M. Tamm, a former Justice Department lawyer who said he was a source for a 2005 New York Times article, will receive a “public censure” but is likely to keep his license.

headline.main: Whistle-Blower on N.S.A. Wiretapping Is Set to Keep Law License
headline.print_headline: Deal Allows Whistle-Blower on N.S.A. Wiretaps to Keep Law License

snippet: Thomas M. Tamm, a former Justice Department lawyer who said he was a source for a 2005 New York Times article, will receive a “public censure” but is likely to keep his license....
